intro: Hydnocarpus setumpul, commonly known as the Java tamarind tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces a unique fruit with a hard, woody husk that encloses a single seed. The bark and roots of Hydnocarpus setumpul contain compounds that have been traditionally used in herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
